H0.text: A molecule is the best description of two atoms of oxygen that are chemically bonded to each other.

H1.text: Compound is the term that best describes two atoms of oxygen that are chemically bonded to each other.

H2.text: Solution is the best description of two atoms of oxygen that are chemically bonded to each other.

H3.text: Mixture is a description of two atoms of oxygen that are chemically bonded to each other.

A4.text: A molecule may be homonuclear, that is, it consists of atoms of one chemical element, e.g. two atoms in the oxygen molecule (O2); or it may be heteronuclear, a chemical compound composed of more than one element, e.g. water (two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom; H2O).

A5.text: a chemical compound composed of more than one element
